Posted By: AlphaNumerical (10/2/2009 12:59:49 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I'm having trouble seeing how it's not STRICTLY worse than sea monster... It gets under [ensnaring bridge](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=ensnaring bridge) easier? =/  
  
However, saying it's strictly better than sea serpent is dumb. Sea Serpent only costs one blue, this costs two. So it's easier to get out. Sea Serpent can't be stolen by non-blue decks with things like Act of Treason, Threaten, etc.   
  
  
I really wish people would stop using "strictly better/worse" arguments. There are very, VERY few cases where it really applies.
posts.html:
I'm having trouble seeing how it's not STRICTLY worse than sea monster... It gets under ensnaring bridge easier? =/

However, saying it's strictly better than sea serpent is dumb. Sea Serpent only costs one blue, this costs two. So it's easier to get out. Sea Serpent can't be stolen by non-blue decks with things like Act of Treason, Threaten, etc.


I really wish people would stop using "strictly better/worse" arguments. There are very, VERY few cases where it really applies.

posts.post_content:
[Aquitect's Will](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Aquitect's Will) If you use merfolk, you get a card, otherwise: [Spreading Seas](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Spreading Seas)  
[Sea's Claim](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sea's Claim) For the 1cmc enchantment  
[Quicksilver Fountain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Quicksilver Fountain) to turn all of your opponents lands into islands :D  
  
Purely abusable in the right deck.
